column1: Collegno (Italian pronunciation: [kolˈleɲɲo]; Piedmontese: Colegn [kʊˈlɛɲ] (listen)) is a comune (municipality) in the Metropolitan City of Turin in the Italian region Piedmont
column2: located about 9 kilometres (6 miles) west of Turin.

column1: It occupies an alluvial plain at the end of the Val di Susa
column3: at the foot of Monte Musinè. The terminal course of the Dora Riparia flows in its territory.

column1: Collegno originated as a Roman mansio 8 kilometres (5 mi) from Turin
column2: known as Quintum Collegium (hence the modern name). Ancient findings from the area are now in the Museum of Antiquities in Turin.
